titleStmt.title: Of a free trade. A discourse seriously recommending to our nation the wonderfull benefits of trade, especially of a rightly governed, and ordered trade. Setting forth also most clearly, the relative nature, degrees, and qualifications of libertie, which is ever to be inlarged, or restrained according to that good, which it relates to, as that is more, or lesse ample. / Written by Henry Parker Esquire.
titleStmt.author: Parker, Henry, 1604-1652.

titleStmt.title: Of a free trade. A discourse seriously recommending to our nation the wonderfull benefits of trade, especially of a rightly governed, and ordered trade. Setting forth also most clearly, the relative nature, degrees, and qualifications of libertie, which is ever to be inlarged, or restrained according to that good, which it relates to, as that is more, or lesse ample. / Written by Henry Parker Esquire.
titleStmt.author: Parker, Henry, 1604-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Fr: Neile for Robert Bostock, dwelling in Pauls Church-yard, at the Signe of the King's Head,

notesStmt.note: The last four pages are numbered: 31, 30, 35, 34.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Feb: 5th 1647"; the 8 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
